page.title: 02HURST LODGE SCHOOL
page.content: Miss Stainer originally had a school in London.She was very interested in dancing because she was a friend of Ninette de Valois.She started the school in Sunningdale,on its present site,during World War 2 which supplied dancing lessons instead of the usual physical education.She supervised the dancing herself but appointed an academic teacher to be in charge of the other lessons.There were originally 15 pupils but the numbers went up to 174 in 15 years,ranging in age from 4 to 17 years. The school building used to be a private house in its own grounds.Extra rooms have been added,including a dance studio and another house called Little Hurst.Recently extra porta cabins have been put up. The school has a kindergarten,Junior Department and a Secondary section.
